website_summaries.verdict: Think of a clean version of Cards Against Humanity that kids can enjoy.
pros: Just edgy enough for kids to enjoy it, but still fun for for Tweens
Great for people who love potty humor
Gets people's hands off of their devices for a while for some face time
cons: A good game for older kids to play together, but it might be a bit boring for adults
Parents might want to check the cards ahead of time to pull out any they do not find appropriate

customer_reviews.title: More suited for 15+ than 8+
customer_reviews.text: Would that I could rate this minus 5. More than a few sexual references. Some nightmare inducing cards. More suited for 15+ than 8+. EMBARASSED to play this with 9, 10, and 12 yo. Going to try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Trite and boring game
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked when one of the cards was political and used President Trump with all the snarky,irreverent cards used. My grandchildren were able to use the cards to call the president a liar and giggle. When asked how the knew he was a liar they said our friends all say that ( this is 13 yr olds). I was sorry to find a fun family game become political. Sorry but I want to play games for fun.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gavan

customer_reviews.title: Pay no attention to those One Star reviews! Easy fix to “their problem” with this game.
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars and here’s why...those of you complaining about some of the Questions and answers- simply pick out those cards and throw them away -still a lot of cards left -and you have a great family game! Simple. 5 minutes of reviewing each card prior to first play and toss the ones that offend you- we left a few poop and fart cards - because we are playing with KIDS and we want to laugh with them! We have so much fun playing with the grandkids and the browns kids of all ages. So don’t let those one star reviews cause you to give up on this game. Fun -Family- Laughing A Lot -Game !
customer_reviews.author: H.L. McK

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed in some if the content of the cards
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old granddaughter. I read the reviews and trusted this was a kid friendly game. I am very disappointed in some if the content of the cards. I would not recommend this game for young children. I would give it 0 stars but that’s not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Game is not there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Game is so-so. I’m not sure why it won any awards. A lot of the red answer cards don’t make sense with the blue “question” cards. Also, answer cards are not that funny. Ive played it several time with a 7, 11, and 13 year old and the only one who found it somewhat funny is the 7 year old and even she grew bored of it. I don’t recommend this game at all. It’s on its way, but not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Horribly unfunny and boring
customer_reviews.text: This game is horribly unfunny. We love cards against humanity and bought this so the my 8 & 10 years could play along cuz they so desperately wanted to play cards against humanity. We played this 4 times and no one laughed once. We all were quite bored. I don’t envision us ever playing again. A waste of $25
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Not for uptight unfunny parent
customer_reviews.text: FUN GAME! Not reccommended for boring, uptight mothers!!! I bought this for my 12 year old son and he loves it. My 8 year old daughter also really enjoys playing it. I picked out like, 4 cards total that I thought were over her head and BAM! Instantly age appropriate! I feel bad for all of the children of the 1 star reviewing moms. The cards "my mom's multiple personalities" and "hacking my parents' password" are not going to inspire a drug addled life of crime. If that is where you draw the line, your kids are already doomed to be mini Norman Bates...es. Highly reccommend. If you have a sense of humor, this game is for you!
customer_reviews.author: dustin shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids and adults alike
customer_reviews.text: If you have boys or men in your family that find gross things funny, they will love this game. We played this as a family, and while the girls just thought it was "ok" but still enjoyed playing it, the boys and hubby were rolling around laughing their heads off, so I would say that this would be a great game for a group of guys playing, or a youth group, or even elementary group made up mostly of boys, but our girls did enjoy it as well - just thought several of the things listed were gross, which made the boys laugh even more...
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Do not play with boring people!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids think this game is funny and fun. Warning! do not play with people with no sense of humor, it will make the game quite boring. Easy and small enough to take with you to a friends. We have enjoyed this for a few minutes and for an evening of fun. Anyone who likes a good giggle and laugh will enjoy this game. We have had this game now for almost a month. The expansion pack is always in the back of my mind, but not necessary yet.
customer_reviews.author: Momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: Really not much fun
customer_reviews.text: This came up on a search as a family-friendly alternative to Cards Against Humanity. It really isn't much fun - it's a fill-in the-blank sort of card game that relies heavily on little boy bathroom humor as its comedic source. A waste of money, but my bad for not investigating more thoroughly before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game for sleepovers
customer_reviews.text: I love Cards Against Humanity and was excited to see a version for kids. My kids took an immediate liking to it and now I can watch more Game of Thrones on Saturday nights. Win-win. I will say the one downside is there aren’t expansion packs yet. Hope they come out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh W.

customer_reviews.title: Ages 8-40 enjoyed
customer_reviews.text: We had a family game night with some other families. We enjoy playing cards against humanity but wanted a kid-friendly version beyond apples to apples jr. This was perfect! It is sometimes hard finding games that my 8, 10, and 13 year old boys will willingly play together. Their friends enjoyed it too and wanted to play again! *I will say there are a few borderline inappropriate depending on how open your family is so we removed a few uncomfortable cards ( like infected private parts for example) and gave the kids an option to swap out cards they didn't feel comfortable with. Other games our family enjoys are bears vs babies and exploding/imploding kittens.
customer_reviews.author: hippie_mom

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious
customer_reviews.text: If you have a sarcastic, witty, gross (think lots of answers with farts) or just plain funny sense of humor this game is sure to bring some laughs. It's a perfect game for tweens that find Apples to Apples too boring, but Cards Against Humanity too vulgar. I monitor what my children are allowed to watch on television and still found this game about 98% just funny. I pulled two cards out of the deck but the rest are fine.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: NOT Appropriate for 9 Year Old
customer_reviews.text: We love games and card games, so I thought this would be perfect based on some of the sample cards. The first set of cards drawn included “puberty” and “balls”-in what way is this game ok for ages starting at 8? I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: G. Power

customer_reviews.title: NPA is hours of fun for a family with kids 5 and up
customer_reviews.text: NPA is hours of fun for a family with kids 5 and up. We took it out for the kids during a family BBQ and they had tons of old-fashioned fun, playing, talking to each other and laughing, instead of staring into screens. And, contrary to the name of the game, I approve as parent. ! We're definitely taking it out during the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy with Age Rating
customer_reviews.text: This is rated for 8 and older. My 7 and 10 year old started playing and some of the cards were geared towards an older child. Lets just say, an 8 year old, aka 3rd grader, isn't at an age yet that puberty is a topic of conversation. Pulled many cards from the deck that I didn't feel were appropriate - should've returned.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Krause

customer_reviews.title: Overall Funny, but some cards are not appropriate.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this game looks really funny and my 8 year old will laugh so hard when he plays this. HOWEVER. There are some cards that are HIGHLY inappropriate for an 8 year old. I chucked those. I found about 15 that were just ridiculous and not age appropriate. With those ones gone, the rest of the cards make for a fun game with family.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly offensive and fun
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious! Unless you are highly offended by gross potty humor and embarrassing “teen” topics, you’ll have a good time. Plays just like CAH but without the extreme adult humor and gore. Great for reluctant readers. My kids thoroughly enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: GinOctopus

customer_reviews.title: great for teenagers to play a game together and get off their phones
customer_reviews.text: great to play with teens (12-16). it keeps it a little more politically correct and not so crass as some of the other games that are similar (cards against humanity). I truly enjoy playing this with my kids and it only gets awkward a few moments because we all know that as teenagers, some how they can still use the card "beat it by michael Jackson" in a naughty way...but for the most part, it makes a lot of stinky socks and far references that make people laugh, but doesn't go as far as the adult games.
customer_reviews.author: Erica McLennan

customer_reviews.title: Fart and puberty jokes ages 8-10
customer_reviews.text: Was going by the reviews hoping it would be a bit more mature so my 18 yr olds could play instead of cards against humanity. Very appropriate for 8-10 yr olds. Lots of fart and puberty jokes.
customer_reviews.author: AAA

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not appropriate for elementary aged kids. Disappointing after reading the description. Retrieved from grandkids after opening.
customer_reviews.author: mokelley

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: Not appropriate for young children
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this product. As the tutor of a fifth grader, I was looking for something fun for playing with words. While the concept sounded good, far too many of these cards emphasize sex, bodily functions, and pop culture references that most kids just wouldn't recognize. (And what's with the joke about Nationwide insurance?!) In addition, quite a few of the cards deride family members--this would be extremely unacceptable given my student's cultural background. Whoever wrote these cards was not thinking. Not everyone finds farts, snot, puberty, masturbation, etc. hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Bell

customer_reviews.title: Potty Humor
customer_reviews.text: Potty humor! For crying out loud! We’re there not any intelligent adults that could have contributed to this “game”? Lowest form of humor! Wish I could get my money back because we won’t be using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Deppie

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to take on my families yearly summer vacation. We like playing games at our cabin after the sun goes down. This game exceeded my expectations and is our new family favorite. There is definitely a lot of "potty humor," but it made for lots of laughs among my daughter's, age 9,10 and 13. This is basically Cards Against Humanity for kids. Lots of fun. Hopefully there will be expansion card packs available in the future, as we played it so much over vacation we will be ready for new cards soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy G.

customer_reviews.title: Try something else
customer_reviews.text: We have played cards against humanity and relative insanity, and I got this for my kids thinking it would be like this. We were very disappointed. The answer cards did not seem to fit well with any of the statement cards. Usually we would be rolling in laughter the whole game with the responses that came up, but here we just felt like we didn't have any cards that would work. We were very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: penguin fan

customer_reviews.title: FUNNY, SILLY, FAMILY GAME for not too proper parents to play with their kids
customer_reviews.text: Soooo much fun for a family with ESPECIALLY boys between 7 and 13 who are into the fart and bathroom jokes. Definately need an unrefined sense of humor to play this game. Somewhat similar to "Cards Against Humanity" but in a PG rated form. Includes potty humor, vomit references, etc., but does not have any sexual references. A mom (44), aunt (46), and grandmother (71) played it with my 11 year old son and his friends for hours over Christmas. There was a lot of laughing and silliness, it was a lot of fun. Highly reccommended for people who have a sense of humor and are not too polite to partake in a little immature 4th grade humor.
customer_reviews.author: cacl

customer_reviews.title: not that great
customer_reviews.text: So we got this for a white elephant christmas present and someone else got a similar game. This was not nearly as good as the other one. The cards range from way to young for some answers to way to grown up for others. We did not enjoy playing at all. The other game was "relative insanity" and it was more grown up (14+) but not wildly inappropriate like cards against humanity.
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: A Good Game for Middle Schoolers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old daughter for Christmas. She always felt left out when we played cards against humanity and obviously that is not a game for a 12 year old. Anyhow, I felt like this was age appropriate. Yes, there are some cards that may be slightly crude and absolutely could be sexual if combined with certain cards. Example: "Why is my brother spending so much time in his room?" (The card said something like that.) For my daughter being almost 13, we can handle those cards and laughed pretty hard. Anyhow, I wouldn't buy this for kids who aren't in middle school yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarrowind

customer_reviews.title: Laughed so hard!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this gift for my nephew for his 11th birthday. He opened it immediately and we played as a family. The game is lots of fun and provides lots of laughs. There is definitely some potty humor, so if you can't appreciate that, this is not for you. My almost 8 year old niece played on my team. It would have been difficult for her to play alone, as some of the reading is challenging and she didn't completely understand ho to choose the best answer. If you want to laugh hysterically with your kids or relatives, I highly recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mom

customer_reviews.title: Gross humor
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and I bought the game to add to my classroom collection thinking it might be a "cool" game. I removed dozens of cards that were just gross. Lots of cards relating to body "humor." Says its for ages 8 and up and they aren't kidding. Not clever at all. Really panders to kids who will ROFL over poop jokes.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT game for tweens and teens!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 boys, 13 and 15, and this is one of our all-time top favorite family games! It's REALLY hard to find something to do as a family that the boys actually think is fun, and this is a WINNER! I just wish there were expansion packs available. I did go through and take out some of the more inappropriate cards - maybe around 10 cards? There were still plenty of cards to keep the game fun! Our older son has high-ish functioning autism and he was able to engage and thought it was hilarious, so the fact that he thought it was cool and kept his attention was huge! More games like this please! Highly highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly in Big D

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son Is 9 and we love family games. As soon as I saw this one online, I one we would like it. We, adults, love cards against humanity, and this game is almost like it just the clean version. Finding out how humorous your child could also fantastic. He cracks us up with his cards, we all laugh. We played about 40 minutes, three people, and there were still cards left. If you are looking for a laugh-filled game, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: A. A.

customer_reviews.title: First turn is based on best burp?!
customer_reviews.text: To be honest we haven’t tried to play it yet. The order in which players order is determined by best burp?! I kid you not...
customer_reviews.author: Cathi C

customer_reviews.title: Few questionable cards but overall fun!
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure about purchasing this for my daycare kids, but it's a blast for them! There's a lot about farts, butts, vomiting, boogers, etc. Disgusting stuff that's hilarious to preteens. I did take out a few that were borderline inappropriate or could cause inappropriate conversations. Picture attached. In my opinion those were the worst cards in the deck, and honestly I probably would've left them in if it was only my kids playing!
customer_reviews.author: sara astheimer

customer_reviews.title: and wanted to be a part of the fun. This game is much more exciting than Apples ...
customer_reviews.text: This game had my 11 and 8 year old laughing out loud. They played it with my nephews ages 12 and 14, even with their grandparents! They were excited to get this game as they hear adults laughing when we play Cards Against Humanity (that they are not allowed to play), and wanted to be a part of the fun. This game is much more exciting than Apples to Apples and has a bit of off color (yet age appropriate) humor that the kids (and adults) find hilarious. I will be purchasing this game for birthday gifts for my sons' friends and my nephews! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: 4 kid with a wide range of ages, finally a family game!
customer_reviews.text: I have four kids with a wide range. Oldest is 13 and youngest is three. They all giggle at the obvious content like farts and burbs and then the cards that I would deem inappropriate for my 8 year but appropriate for my 13 year completely go over my 8 year olds’ head (hot girls, my 8 year old thinks in literal terms) Phew. A game we can all play together!!! My three year old just pretends to read them and dumps the cards out which is totally fine because cards can be everywhere, who cares! It doesn’t affect the game.
customer_reviews.author: Quatropadres

customer_reviews.title: Great game. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is pretty fun. Bought it as a gift for my 12 and 11 year old for Christmas and played it that night. They had a blast with it and want to play it all the time. There are tons of cards and even blank cards so you can make up some of your own. The questions and answers cards are age appropriate which I was happy about. I looked through tons of games like this and most were just for adults or for younger kids. I would definitely recommend this to game loving families with pre teen/teenage kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: A little too mature for the younger ones
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not appropriate for an 8 year old! We stopped playing a few rounds in! Teenagers maybe, not an 8 year old!
customer_reviews.author: keri

customer_reviews.title: Small Cards!
customer_reviews.text: These should have been more emphasized and stated in the main description of the product. These are what are referred to as Mini cards, and not the standard card size like Cards Against Humanity and many other 3rd party Decks adhere to. I wanted to add this to my massive deck that is over 10k playable cards. But I will not. I will gift them to a friend that has kids. I ordered this back in 2018 during a Lighting Deal and the return window was until Jan 2019.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for teenagers too.
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old was convinced that he would not like this game and only begrudgingly agreed to play with us. He was shrieking with laughter. We've played the "adult" version of this game and honestly this one was almost as much fun. Since we are a family of three we included our dog as a "ghost" player to mix things up a bit (picking a random card on the dog's behalf), this added an extra layer of hilarity when the dog won a couple of rounds for choosing the most ridiculous entry.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages, if potty humor is ok in your house.
customer_reviews.text: We had friends over for New Year’s, and the adults would be playing Cards Against Humanity, and I thought maybe the kids would enjoy something similar and picked this game up. O.M.G., the snickers, belly laughs, guffaws, and full on hilarity that we heard made US smile and the evening was that much more enjoyable. 4 boys between the ages of 8-11/13 got a huge kick out of it, so it wins in the coolness category. We (parents), played it with them, as well, and it was fun for us, too, although I think the kids liked playing their friends better (it is called not parent approved, after all).
customer_reviews.author: CROCHET QUEEN

customer_reviews.title: This game is a riot
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new game that our family could play together and purchasers this game after reading the reviews. So glad I did! This game is a riot and we’ve literally been in tears from laughing so hard. Our kids range from 7 years old to 11 years old and it’s been great for all of them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trendy Mom

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim and couldn't be happier! Great family game that the kids LOVED! The "inappropriate" humor of bleach, fart and poop jokes had us laughing hysterically. My 11 year kids led nephew is asking for another one so he can play with his friends!
customer_reviews.author: TDeStefano

customer_reviews.title: Super Corny
customer_reviews.text: Super corny! We bought this to play with our 10 year old twins and it was OK but definitely not one of the best games of the year. I thought we would be laughing a lot but it was just so corny. I wouldn’t waste my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Book M Lover

customer_reviews.title: My tweens and teens loved this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a stocking stuffer. Hosted a group of teens & tweens for New Year’s Eve and they went off to play it. At some point, they switched to a different game for a little while. Soon I could hear them saying, “Let’s play NPA again.” They played for hours! It was no longer about getting to 5 wins. They didn’t even care who won. They were just having a blast and cracking up at their own creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids version Cards against Humanity
customer_reviews.text: This is literally just a tween version of cards against humanity. It’s played exactly the same way. It was boring for the adults playing with our kids because it didn’t apply to us. But my tween Son said he could use it with his friends. Definitely not a family game though, not engaging for parents with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Cospsuimom

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining NOT
customer_reviews.text: The only thing funny about this game is its name. After playing this game with my son & grandkids I realize how difficult it is to come up with a truly entertaining game. This is NOT it. It's so boring and trite that the kids acted like it was torture to continue. Bottom line.... don't waste your money. These jokers who created it need to go back to the drawing board and come up with something that's at least what they say it is. Not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: C. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I thought. Many blank cards. Many repeat cards. With 5 adults and two kids (12 & 15) we played one round then put it away. No one enjoyed it. I guess if we had known ahead of time about the blanks and repeats, I would have taken them all out first. But, now it will just collect dust on the shelf. Would not recommend at all. And we LOVE these kinds of games.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tween/teens
customer_reviews.text: My boys were begging to play cards against humanity - but at 12, I wasn’t ready to allow that... they just wanted to be included... so I tried this game... they love it!! Even my adult friends do too! Now we can play this as a family, then after they go to bed, we switch to the grown up version!!!
customer_reviews.author: DesertKat

customer_reviews.title: Definitely for young teens. Not so much for families, or adults. They'd be bored.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing paritcularly funny, and I bought it hoping it'd be a less horrible version of cards against type games that my whole family could play. It is... if you're between the ages of 15- maybe 17 and like fart humor. The slightly sexual references mean it's no good for middle schoolers and almost all the cards are aimed at someone still in school and living at home- in other words, teens. I don't know if teen me would have found it very funny either. A lot of the prompts cannot match the answers to make sentences that make any kind of sense so it's hard to answer.
customer_reviews.author: Rosslyn

customer_reviews.title: The best family night card game EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This game really is one of the BEST card games I have ever purchased for family night. We have at LEAST hours of fun before the game ends. The sentences can be odd but that's the fun! They appeal to that silly humor of young kids and its a blast watching them play! I would 100000% recommend this game to any family! Great interaction and huge laughs!
customer_reviews.author: C. Mcafee

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Present for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: Cards Against Humanity and KinderPerfect are great games to play with adults, but those aren’t games for kids. This is! Our two girls (8 and 10) love this game and always want to play it with their friends AND with us as parents. Win win for everyone involved. Bonus: they are reading and strategizing and don’t even know it
customer_reviews.author: Wayan

customer_reviews.title: This was a total hit with my 12-year old nephew!
customer_reviews.text: This game is silly and gross, awesomely fun, and appropriate for about ages 9 and up (for the most part). My nephew, who is 12, wanted to play it over and over again - and we were all laughing SO hard! Out of the hundreds of cards, there were only a couple that I considered a little borderline or risque for the targeted age group (cards where the responses were "puberty" or "balls" which could be interpreted certain ways), so parents will likely want to review the cards first (always wise) to make sure no one gets embarrassed or is made uncomfortable. It was so fun overall, I'm planning on getting my nephew the expansion pack!
customer_reviews.author: Julia B. Spann

customer_reviews.title: The more, the merrier!
customer_reviews.text: My son will be 10 in two weeks. Our daughter is 20. My husband and I played this with them last night. The games went quickly, and we had a blast! We all laughed and had a good time. I believe this game would be even more fun with more than 4. 4 is the absolute minimum. I also think it would be fun to add people in the game who you know more casually. It adds an element of difficulty because you don’t know them as intimately as those in your household. This is an age-appropriate game that is a cross between Apples to Apples and a G-Rated or PG-Rated Cards Against Humanity.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: So many of the cards do not go well together. 14 year old daughter was bored with it. We kept drawing cards until we found something that would go with the question. Waste of money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for 3 generations
customer_reviews.text: The whole family loves it, from the 8 year old to the grandparents. The grandparents actually weren't sure at first, but they should have taken their cue from the fact that the kids' mom (me) was the one suggesting it. Believe it or not, this game is less inappropriate than other games the adults in our family play, but usually we wait for kids to be otherwise occupied. It was fun to see the kids feel so grown up to be able to play, too.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Burdine

customer_reviews.title: Inappropriate content
customer_reviews.text: Not appropriate at all for my 8 year old. Unhappy with this game.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy

customer_reviews.title: Lowest form of humor!
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP CARDS, STUPID AND VERY INAPPROPRIATE GAME I CAN'T UNDERSTAND THE GOOD REVIEWS
customer_reviews.author: loped

customer_reviews.title: Not too many objectionable cards to be sorted out
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive after reading some of the more critical parent reviews, but decided to purchase this after reading some of the teacher reviews. I did take some cards out of the deck, but not too many. As far as I know, my grandchildren didn't choose to play it (out of several games on hand), so I can't comment as to that. If they do not find it interesting, I will donate it to my local middle school or a thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: Austen Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all ages 8+
customer_reviews.text: My kids and their friends and cousins LOVE this game. Their "to-cool-for-school" friend made fun of them because we won't let them play "real" cards against humanity. So I sweetly said, "I have played CAH and I like this game more, you can make funnier sayings with it" and he gave in and played and loved it. Some kids are tough but once they play, it's all good. Really, who let's their 12 y.o. play CAH anyway? Point is, this is a great game regardless. The "rule follower" oldest child types tend to not like this game until age 10. Youngest kids start right in at school age (8ish)
customer_reviews.author: Heidi K. Helfen

customer_reviews.title: Kid-friendly version of CAH
customer_reviews.text: I love games. I am a game hoarder. I love unwinding from a busy week and enjoying quality family time. Game night is when we can all relax with some friendly (sometimes not so friendly) competition. This was a new game for us. We enjoyed it. It was nice to try new and take a break from our usual favorites. This game was great. My child who is too young to play CAH, really enjoyed this. Definitely had some laugh attacks. Family fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids 9 and older
customer_reviews.text: This is such a hilarious game, for kids and adults!! I had read the comments before getting, so as soon as we got it, I went they the cards to pull out any inappropriate ones... but I didn’t really see any. My son is 9. He did take this game to aftercare and the teachers there would not let them play it, but there were 5 year olds in the room. We played it with a 20 something cousin and he loved it!! We were all in tears laughing so hard!!
customer_reviews.author: hillary daniels

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun; Really ages 12 and up?
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice “tween” version of Cards Against Humanity! Kids had a great time playing at Thanksgiving with cousins. Kids ages 16, 13, 10, and 8. Box says ages 8 and up, but I feel a few of the cards a tiny bit too mature for the 8 year old and maybe the 10... (one says “the word balls” for example). A few cards can’t be used with some of the subject cards (parts of speech conflict) whereas in other games like this all the cards work (at least grammatically) all the time. But, overall this is a fun game and we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher and Mommy

customer_reviews.title: and we all loved it. Just the right amount of fart jokes ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew for Christmas and we played it as a family, with people from 8 years to 60 years, and we all loved it. Just the right amount of fart jokes to keep a pre-teen boy happy.
customer_reviews.author: LeapFeetFirst

customer_reviews.title: Fun! Fast Paced! Family Friendly!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for the family. My kids loved it, and we laughed a lot while playing it. Super easy to learn Like Apples to Apples or Cards Against Humanity, but somewhere in the middle. We went through most of the cards in one sitting. And have played it a few times since. We are starting to repeat some of the cards, which is still fun, but not as fun as the first time around. I would like to see a larger starting set So that it doesn’t feel like I need to buy an expansion pack the third time we play the game.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Not for teens either
customer_reviews.text: Looking for something to do on a long car ride. This was not it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean D. Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: A family hit on game night
customer_reviews.text: We always loved apples to apples and still do. But now the kids are older, age 11 and 13. Like I said apples to apples is still fun but the game "not parent approved" is better suited for my tweens. Some of the cards are edgy and are very current to the times, but not as raunchy as cards against humanity, making this game perfectly family friendly and hilariously fun. It's a perfect game acting as a bridge for apples to apples, to cards against humanity. We all love it and if you enjoy games and gut busting laughs you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: N4sir

customer_reviews.title: Ages 11-66 We had a blast!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Not Parent Approved last minute before Christmas. Never have we had so much laughter and fun playing with the 4 Grand kids ages 10-19 along with their parents. Grandma even won and was a big hit. We will be sure to play it every time they come to visit. That was last year. I ordered the expansion pack for Thanksgiving. We lost power for 36 hours so we huddled around the fireplace , added the expansion pack and played through the entire decks. It was fun reading the new questions and answers. We laugh and teased. I especially love how the kids take on different personalities or voices while reading the silliest or grossest cards.
customer_reviews.author: S Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Super cute kids game.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute game. There were a couple of inappropriate cards, just a couple that were innapropriate for our home but I just pulled them out and tossed them. We have had so much fun playing Cards Against Humanity I wondered what the appropriate equivlenat would be for kids. This is it. I got it to play with my teen and wanted it so she can also play it with her friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: It's a kids version of cards against humanity. Let's my pre-teen boys feel like they're being really naughty, but still fairly wholesome...at least by my standards. I think some of my mom-friends may disagree and think it's too much for their kids. [That's why I didn't think it is a great gift.] 4 stars on age appropriate... solid for my 12yo, some are little much for my 10yo. That totally varies by kids and their "worldly knowledge" or development of their sense of humor.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family - really!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this game and the whole family loves it! We have an 11 year old and a 15 year old so it is hard to find games that they both enjoy. We play "Apples to Apples" periodically but our 11 year old doesn't know who some of the people on the cards are and our older child, my husband and I have a more mature sense of humor so it's tough to play that together. This game, on the other hand, has stuff he can relate to and that we all find funny so it's awesome! We all really loved playing it and ended up staying up way too late :)
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Mama

customer_reviews.title: Some Innappropriate cards
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of the adult version of this game so I was really excited when I found this. I love the game. It’s great, easy to play and takes up very little room in our game closet. The only reason I didn’t give it five stars is because it says 8 and up but some of the answers are innapropriate. We didn’t realize it until we were playing and came across one of the cards. We had to go through all the cards and pick out the ones that were innappropriate.
customer_reviews.author: L K

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Not a great game, the cost is way too high for what it is. It is kind of boring.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: My son couldn't get enough of this game
customer_reviews.text: Well, 5 stars means I love it, but the reality is I'm putting in the vote for my 11-year-old son. I bought this as a Christmas gift with some hesitancy, and we all played it over the holiday. My son obviously couldn't get enough of it. It tickled has fancy in a big way. So yes, it may not be for the adults, but it's a clean and engaging game full of references to school and youth life that speaks to kids.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Miner

customer_reviews.title: fun for the family, if you like potty humor
customer_reviews.text: this is like a mostly kid friendly version of Cards Against Humanity. We played this game with our family in Christmas Eve (our family of 5 and two set of Grandparents, so ages 5 to 73.). We had the best time and so many laughs when we played. the second time we played we were already getting some repeat cards, but worth different prompts, which was fine, but u can tell we will need some expansion cards and to use the blanks that came with the game to keep it fresh. there is lots and lots of potty humor in this game, so if you're kids love that kind of stuff like mine, they will definitely love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Miller

customer_reviews.title: BURPING? OKAY WE ALL HAVE TO PLAY
customer_reviews.text: Now, I don't particularly enjoy burping - but upon reading the instruction aloud to the kids they all jumped to play it at least for the deciding factor of burping in the beginning. Slowly we got into the questions and answers and while a few were kind of boring they quickly got more and more funny and us adults and the kids were all laughing at the answers. We played several rounds and went to dinner but all they could do was ask when we could play again. They were ages (13 and 14) boy and girl. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Cross

customer_reviews.title: A hit with both kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: This game was a great addition to family game night! My 9- and 11-year-olds enjoy Apples to Apples, and this game is the same concept but much funnier. I think 10 and up is a good age for this game, though depending on your 8- or 9-year-old, it can be fine for that age as well. When my oldest kid (24) comes over, that’s what he wants to play too, so it’s a hit with all ages. I think of it as Cards Against Humanity but appropriate for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy A

customer_reviews.title: Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples for Middle Schoolers and up
customer_reviews.text: Got this game for our 15-year-old for Christmas, and the four of us (2 adults, 15- and 17-year-old boys) spent an hour playing it and laughing together. It lands somewhere between the games "Apples to Apples" and "Cards Against Humanity" but still appropriate for tweens and teens. Not sure I'd play it with kids under the age of 11 or so, but sure fun for us! Also got the game "Kids Against Maturity," so can't wait to see how it compares.
customer_reviews.author: D. McCabe

customer_reviews.title: My Nephew says it's a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for my 12 year old nephew and it has quickly become his favorite game. I gave it to him on Christmas, on NYE he informed me that he asks everyone to play it all the time (followed by a "you pick the best games!). I will say that the humor is a little crude...but not unbearable. My 10 year old son played with us and didn't understand some of the references. I would suggest looking over the cards first and choosing what is acceptable to your family before playing. All-in-all I'd say it's a great game that kids will enjoy just for the mischief factor.
customer_reviews.author: JamesB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by the quality of the material for the price
customer_reviews.text: We host a lot of parent/child game nights with friends and I am excited to play this with the 11 to 13 year old group. I scanned through a good portion of the cards, there aren't many that I would remove. The cards are right in line with tween humor. BUT I have to say I am disappointed with the quality of the cards for the price. We own a lot of games like this one, in comparison to most the cards are SMALL and flimsy. I wonder how well it will hold up well over time.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful family game!!!
customer_reviews.text: My family LOVES this game! We are a family of two adults, two 11 year olds and a 6 year old. It covers all age groups. Sometimes the cards are too “old” for the six year old but I knew this going in. I would recommend this game to families of 8 and older for sure. It is a wonderful gap filler between Apples to Apples junior and CAH (definitely not child appropriate, but great for adults). Just ordered the expansion packs to take on vacation this summer, since we play this game weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Funniest Family Game yet!!!
customer_reviews.text: My twin 10 yr old boys have Autism. Language arts and reading is difficult for them. And their attention span is maybe 15 minutes before they change directions. My boys, my Hubby, my mother in law and myself LOVED this G rated version of cards against humanity. We played for over an hour - laughing, giggling and just having a good time. My boys were engaged the entire time! And the kids are reading the cards for themselves and coming up with the wildest combinations. We have played it multiple times and every time is the same - filled with laughter and fun. We are purchasing the expansion packs in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. D.

customer_reviews.title: Kids played it once - not sure why they say it won reviews
customer_reviews.text: 4 boys in the family played the game and were bored with it instantly. 10-12 year olds. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: lv

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is an absolute blast for the whole family! Typically when my large family gets together for game nights, my nieces and nephews are left out because our games are very mature. The card game is the perfect compromise that allows us all to have fun! The basis is very similar to Cards Against Humanity, but the cards are all appropriate for kids without sacrificing good humor. That being said, if you aren’t a fan of fart and poop jokes, this game probably isn’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: Labbottomy

customer_reviews.title: Soo glad I bought this, hilarious!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are between 8-12 and we played this and all were laughing. Fun to find a game that the adults enjoy as much as kids. I've never heard my son laugh so hard as when he played "a mad bad duck in a petting zoo". There might be like 4-5 cards that could be questionable so if you don't like those ones just toss them. Personally we all loved the game and I want to buy the expansion packs.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie J.

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun (as long as you don't mind potty humor)
customer_reviews.text: My 2 kids (boys age 10 and 12) love this game, and it really is fun for the whole family. It is funnier than Apples to Apples, but not as crude as Card Against Humanity. We loved it so much that we bought another as a gift. The receiving child/family loves it as much as we do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Cards Against Humanity for the younger crowd. Plays exactly like it and is as much fun for that age group. Got this based on a recommendation from a friend and gave it to my son at his birthday party. Seeing six boys and girls (ages 9-13) all sitting around playing cards at a table without any electronics was totally worth it. They even played it again later in the night after nerf wars and video games - and without me prompting them. Well made game!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Not appropriate for kids
customer_reviews.text: listed for 8 years and up. No way a bunch of those can be used by an 8 year old. Totally misleading and inappropriate.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: The kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a family game to play with my 11 and 13 year old boys. They think this is hilarious and love it. There were some reviews saying it was inappropriate, so I was a bit hesitant, but we haven’t found any that inappropriate....the worst was a card that said “Uranus” for an answer. We played for two hours on NYE and the following day, they set it up to play again. Any game that makes our kids want to spend time with us is a winner in my book!
customer_reviews.author: DMG

customer_reviews.title: Best For 7-10 Year Old Boys!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a family game that was more appropriate than Cards Against Humanity to play with my older teen daughters (even though I know they play CAH with their friends). This game is for a younger set. Perfect for 7-10 year olds, particularly boys. Statements refer to skid marks in your underwear, mucousy things, and kicked in the balls sort of juvenile humor. Nothing wrong with that - like I said, perfect for a particular age range.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our kids so they could play it while on our Christmas snow trip to Tahoe. They loved it and when we came home and had friends over for New Years Eve, all the kids got together and played and laughed for a long time. It was fun to hear them having a great time together. I’m not always super stoked about the goofy things in the game, but the kids get a kick out of it. Heard someone mentioning “butt acne”...not sure what I think about that, but everyone was laughing like crazy. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Won't Be Able to Quit Laughing
customer_reviews.text: This game was more fun than we thought! We laugh & laugh & laugh every time we play it! There are a few questionable cards, but we just tossed those. For the most part, very hilarious! Especially geared towards gross stuff (like farts that stay in your pants, etc), but makes it a good game for tween boys! I highly recommend for family bonding!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A

customer_reviews.title: Fun for adults and kids.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother and law and his family for christmas. The kids love to play games with everyone and us adults love cards against humanity so I was happy to discover this game. We played a short game on Christmas and it went really well. Hoping to play a few more times and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Y.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, choices don't fit easily
customer_reviews.text: While this is a good idea with some funny cards, we had trouble finding cards that worked in context a good portion of the time. So you are often relegated to trying to fit an action into a noun's place, vice versa and so on. While in adult games like Cards Against Humanity you can usually get things to work in context, not the same here. For that reason I've taken off stars. For the price, I'd like something that played smoother with more time taken to assure that cards will fit context. When you have 7 cards and nothing works, the game's a bit rough around the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Moody G

customer_reviews.title: Good for people who are more modest!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 21 year old brother who likes the cards against humanity game, but not all the vulgar, nasty cards. I am sure he will have much fun with it! I would for sure just judge the person rather than their age. Some people are ok with giving this to younger kids, and some are not. It’s all about personal preference and the person’s playing modesty.
customer_reviews.author: E. WALKER

customer_reviews.title: It was so much fun! Kids & I were laughing hard belly laughs
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our kids for Hanukkah and this morning I played it with them. It was so much fun! Kids & I were laughing hard belly laughs. There were a couple of cards that border on inappropriate but only because as an adult I know more than they do. I think it's also a good game for kids to play with parents so they can see that their parents find humor in "gross" stuff too. My kids are 9 & 12.
customer_reviews.author: S. Willinger

customer_reviews.title: Very in appreciate!
customer_reviews.text: This game was so inappropriate! The description does not describe it correctly at all. I sent this to my nieces and nephews and was so embarrassed. T
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Parent approvable
customer_reviews.text: My grandson would not even acknowledge acceptance, I could not return it they threw it away, I was sick, I lost my money and gift... The description made it sound like fun, dont be fooled... I want a refund from Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Dee Kerry

customer_reviews.title: BIG HIT WITH OUT KIDS
customer_reviews.text: We all absolutely LOVED this game. Played it on Xmas morn as it was a Santa gift for my 9year old twins. We were all laughing hysterically. Such a great way to spend the time. The kids then proceeded to take it on a trip with their cousins ages 10-12. BIG HIT! We were in a hotel and they were laughing so hard we had to ask them to keep it down on multiple occasions. Will definitely put this on our birthday party gift list to give out to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Kale Diva

customer_reviews.title: so much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. It is super fun. Cards against humanity for kids. There are a few cards that make my kids uncomfortable but I just take them out. There are so many cards itll take months of play to go through all of them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Not Parent Approved: A Fun Card Game for Kids, Tweens, Teens, Families and Mischief Makers - The Original, Hilarious Family Party Game
feature_bullets: THE BEST, HILARIOUS, AWARD-WINNING PARTY GAME - A fun card game for families - for tweens, teens and their families that brings everyone together and makes a perfect gift for kids and teens (4-10 players, ages 8+). Amazon Launchpad approved!

EVERYONE WILL WANT TO PLAY - Inspired by Cards Against Humanity, but 100% family-friendly. Designed to reintroduce a love of family games for a screen-obsessed generation. Attention-grabbing. Easy-to-learn. Quick, simple play.
WARNING: Kids will unplug and put down their phones. Cards contain gratuitous bathroom humor that kids will find hilarious while distracted from their screens. You might even giggle a few times.

DURABLE CARDS, PORTABLE GAME - Comes with 455 high-quality, premium-printed cards (2"x3") and rules insert in a custom shrink-wrapped box. Its take-anywhere size is great for parties, sleepovers, road trips, flights, picnics, and summer camps. It's not just a tabletop game - take the laughter with you wherever you go!

GREAT FOR RELUCTANT READERS - Winner of Scholastic's Gold Star Toy Award. Scholastic Review says you can consider this game "your secret weapon against reluctant readers, as one tester said it improved her daughter’s reading skills." A fun game for kids - with benefits!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,099 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
